image.altText: The Israel-Gaza border fence snakes through rocky low hills, past occasional clusters of vegetation.

props.synopsis: There might be a ceasefire, but the people of Gaza are far from free. This is a brief look beyond Israel's fortified border wall.

title.children: With Israel still in charge, this is the only glimpse of Gaza international media can get

image.altText: A man with glasses and a lanyard stands in front of a whiteboard.

props.synopsis: One of the "pivotal contributors" to creating the Chinese artificial intelligence chatbot DeepSeek studied computer science in Australia for several years.

title.children: Before helping to create DeepSeek, this engineer was an Australian uni student

image.altText: A woman lays out fabric on a table to prepare cutting it next to Shein packaging.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's last trade war with China allowed Shein and Temu to become e-commerce giants during a cost-of-living crisis. But his latest tariffs will not hurt the companies as much as those who rely on them.

title.children: Trump's tariffs on China are a 'double-whammy' for Temu and Shein

image.altText: A map showing the location of Starlink satellites

props.synopsis: In regional and remote Australian communities, Starlink is becoming the internet provider of choice but with that comes fears of what happens when they are forced to rely on Elon Musk?

title.children: 'Petulant and erratic': Why remote Australia relying on Musk's Starlink could be an issue

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a blue suit and red tie with lips pouted mid-sentence in front of a blurred painting of George Washington

props.synopsis: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz has told the country's military to form plans that allow Palestinians the freedom to leave Gaza.Â

title.children: Israeli minister tells army to set plans for Palestinians to leave Gaza

image.altText: A fireball rises from a strike on a target inside Gaza.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's proposal for Gaza saw his own administration walk it back but the Palestinian Authority's own foreign minister wants Australia to reject it.

title.children: 'Doesn't include me': The Palestinian problem with Trump's Gaza proposal

image.altText: Pauline Hanson speaking

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton held a rare press conference, as did Pauline Hanson, who left 28 long awkward seconds of silence after announcing her new policy.Â

title.children: Pauline Hanson called a press conference to announce a major policy. What followed was awkward silence

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at Garma Festival

props.synopsis: The federal government is promising $842.6 million over six years for remote Aboriginal communities in the Northern Territory, including for essential services such as policing, women's safety and alcohol harm reduction.

title.children: Federal government pledges $840m towards Closing the Gap in the NT

image.altText: A woman wearing a black jacket with her hair tied back walks past a woman filming her with her phone

props.synopsis: Both Ms Kerr and her fiancÃ© Kristie Mewis have given evidence and been cross-examined in the high-profile trial in London.

title.children: Sam Kerr denies using police officer's 'whiteness' to insult and harm him, court hears

image.altText: Crowds of people walk from the Martin Place station in central sydney.

props.synopsis: Positive signs around falling inflation are balanced against increased uncertainty, which threatens to weigh on household consumption and business investment.

title.children: Signs point to inflation falling but jump in unemployment 'cannot be ruled out'

image.altText: Travis Head, Dinesh Chandimal and Mitchell Starc

props.synopsis: Travis Head proves he is the ultimate golden arm and Mitchell Starc works wonders with both the old and new ball as Sri Lanka's risky selection call pays off. Here are the quick hits from day one of the second Test in Galle.

title.children: Quick hits: Head's celebration, Starc's mastery and a Sri Lankan gamble

image.altText: A drone view of a town in Santorini, Greece, with white buildings with blue roofs, overlooking the Aegean Sea.

props.synopsis: A 5.2 magnitude tremor has been detected between the Greek islands of Santorini and Amorgos â the most powerful recorded since activity started on on January 31.Â

title.children: State of emergency declared in Santorini amid earthquakes

image.altText: Mass shooting vigil in Orebro

props.synopsis: Details about Sweden's mass school shooter are emerging as the country mourns the victims of the deadly attack.

title.children: Details emerge about Sweden mass shooter as victims mourn deadliest gun attack

image.altText: Wreckage of airplane in a rice field in Maguindanao del Sur province, Philippines

props.synopsis: US Embassy and Philippine officials confirmed the deaths of all on-board near the farming municipality of Ampatuan on Mindanao island.Â

title.children: Four dead including US service member in military-contracted Philippines plane crash

image.altText: Three people holding signs with marshmallows saying 'burnt out' and 'reform now'

props.synopsis: Junior doctors in NSW are threatening to walk off the job after the circulation of an email written by an HR officer who likened them to confectionery.

title.children: Leaked email from HR calling doctors 'marshmallows' sparks fury

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: A woman wearing a grey top and sunglasses sits outside a hospital building.

props.synopsis: Perth's housing crisis is so dire, Kerry Mitchell-Bathgate is using her son's hospital room as a makeshift bedsit while she struggles to find a roof to put over her head.Â

title.children: FIFO worker Kerry had it all. Now she's living in her son's hospital room

image.altText: A CIA emblem on the floor of a building.

props.synopsis: The CIA is offering all of its employees incentives to resign â and some say its part of a move by US President Donald Trump to stack the government in his favour.Â

title.children: Five US spy agencies are offering buyouts to every employee. Here's what's going on

image.altText: A lawyer dressed for a court and a woman in a suit arrive at the Federal Court.

props.synopsis: The ABC managing director told an unlawful termination hearing he reviewed Antoinette Lattouf's social media feeds and grew concerned about what he saw.Â

title.children: ABC boss asked if the Lebanese race exists in Lattouf case

image.altText: A sliced egg on a bed of stewed greens in a tiny bowl. The yolk looks not quite set but not too liquidy.

props.synopsis: The idea of a perfectly cooked egg is subjective, but Italian scientists think they have cracked a method for optimising flavour and texture in both yolk and whites.

title.children: The 'perfect' egg takes 32 minutes to cook, study suggests

image.altText: Joe Schmidt looks behind him

props.synopsis: In a major blow for Australian rugby, Joe Schmidt has confirmed he will not steer the Wallabies through to the 2027 Rugby World Cup at home.

title.children: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt to stand down after Rugby Championship

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair smiling pointing to her black t shirt which says "say something"

props.synopsis: Former Queensland Australian of the Year Rachel Downie is suing Rockhampton Grammar School for at least $5 million in compensation, arguing it failed to appropriately address her reporting of the abuse.

title.children: Child protection advocate sues elite private school over alleged abuse in 1980s

image.altText: A smiling mother with her newborn girl.

props.synopsis: Amid the tragedy and destruction in flood-ravaged North Queensland there has also been joy.

title.children: Hospital a 'beacon of light' as mum gives birth in flood-ravaged town

image.altText: People coming off a train

props.synopsis: The peak rail union has confirmed to the ABC its plans to inform the NSW government about the launch of new work bans, risking more disruption to Sydney's train network.Â

title.children: Rail union threatens new work bans to 'escalate' Sydney train disruptions

image.altText: A close up of a bearded man with shaggy dark hair and a black blazer tilts his head to the left as he listens

props.synopsis: From Netflix to Disney and Amazon Prime, multiple studios have paused or cancelled adaptations of Neil Gaiman's best-selling books following allegations made by multiple women.

title.children: Projects cancelled after eight women accuse author Neil Gaiman of abuse

image.altText: a plume of smoke arises from a bushfire

props.synopsis: As Tasmania battles more than a dozen fires sparked by a band of dry lightning strikes, some in high-value wilderness areas, researchers are raising the possibility that this is the 'new normal'.

title.children: Tasmania's wilderness areas at increasing risk of fire, researchers say

image.altText: A family poses for a photo in front of a temple in Indonesia

props.synopsis: Lily Lumintang was reading an ABC story about her family's plea to remain in Australia when her lawyer called to say Home Affairs had granted their family visas, allowing them to avoid deportation and remain in Australia.

title.children: Indonesian family's Australian residency approved after ABC inquiries

image.altText: Kaitlyn Dever recreates Belle Gibson's infamous 60 Minutes interview, with a ponytail and pink jumper.

props.synopsis: American actor Kaitlyn Dever talks about finding the good beneath the surface of Australian cancer scammer Belle Gibson, and the rise of the wellness industry.

title.children: New series tells the story of Belle Gibson, the influencer who scammed Australia

image.altText: Man in a school attendance officer uniform

props.synopsis: Truancy officers fan out through Alice Springs on the lookout for kids who should be in school, with recalcitrant parents facing fines of $370.

title.children: On patrol with the NT's school enforcers as parents face $370 fines

image.altText: A police officer and vehicle blocking a road.

props.synopsis: Police have made an emergency declaration after a man was shot with a homemade gun on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Streets in lockdown after man shot with homemade gun on Gold Coast

image.altText: An old weatherboard building with sand dunes falling away, rubbish on the beach

props.synopsis: A Queensland council will put an asbestos-riddled former surf life saving clubhouse out of its misery after erosion put it at risk of falling into the sea.

title.children: Beachfront 'eyesore' to be demolished after erosion exposes foundations

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens who have been hospitalised in Thailand

props.synopsis: Laos has failed to accept "consistent" offers by Australian Federal Police to assist the investigation into the methanol poisoning deaths of Australian teenagers Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles.

title.children: Laos has not accepted AFP offers to aid methanol poisoning investigation

image.altText: Sarah Shams in a bright pink skirt

props.synopsis: As a double above-knee amputee, I've had a complicated relationship with fashion over the years.

title.children: My clothing makes me feel fierce: The joy of dressing for myself
